TI: [Selective attention and memory: evoked potentials in visual and auditory verbal competition].
AB: The brain mechanisms of the selective verbal attention were studied using evoked potential (EP) technique. It was shown that the late "cognitive" EP components (400-800 ms) related to memory function were more positive to the words presented via a relevant sensory channel and more negative to irrelevant words. The hypothesis is advanced that words delivered via two competing sensory channels, such as visual and auditory, are perceived, i.e., the subject sees and hears them. However, irrelevant signals are not stored in episodic memory due to the active inhibition of the information transmission to the hippocampal structures.
AD: Institute of Higher Nervous Activity and Neurophysiology, Russian Academy of Sciences, Moscow.
TT: Izbiratel'noe vnimanie i pamiat' -- vyzvannye potentsialy pri konkurentsii zritel'nykh i slukhovykh slovesnykh signalov.
TA: Zh Vyssh Nerv Deiat Im I P Pavlova
JT: Zhurnal vysshei nervnoi deiatelnosti imeni I P Pavlova
SO: Zh Vyssh Nerv Deiat Im I P Pavlova. 2003 Sep-Oct;53(5):541-51.
